ci_support_linux_.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge,defaults
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- condaforge/linux-anvil-comp7

about.description:
Dexplot provides an easy-to-use, consistent approach to making insightful data
visualizations in python. It gives its users tremendous power to create the exact
plots they desire without trouble. Several apps are available to explore data
in Jupyter Notebooks.
about.summary: Powerful and intuitive data visualization library using matplotlib for both long and wide data

about.description:
Dexplot provides an easy-to-use, consistent approach to making insightful data
visualizations in python. It gives its users tremendous power to create the exact
plots they desire without trouble. Several apps are available to explore data
in Jupyter Notebooks.
about.summary: Powerful and intuitive data visualization library using matplotlib for both long and wide data

name: dexplot
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "dexplot" %}
{% set version = "0.1.4" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 0a9aee9685a2a69f4243684c75077a7cea012973c4cff4ce0a661a5c880973a2

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: python
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv

requirements:
  host:
    - pip
    - python >=3.6
  run:
    - numpy >=1.15
    - pandas >=0.24
    - python >=3.6
    - scipy >=1.0
    - matplotlib-base >=3.1

test:
  imports:
    - dexplot
  commands:
    - pip check
  requires:
    - pip

about:
  home: https://dexplo.org/dexplot
  license: BSD-3-Clause
  license_family: BSD
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: 'Powerful and intuitive data visualization library using matplotlib for both long and wide data'
  description: |
    Dexplot provides an easy-to-use, consistent approach to making insightful data
    visualizations in python. It gives its users tremendous power to create the exact
    plots they desire without trouble. Several apps are available to explore data
    in Jupyter Notebooks.
  doc_url: https://dexplo.org/dexplot
  dev_url: https://github.com/dexplo/dexplot

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - tdpetrou
